data.title: Delightful Surprise
data.text: We will return! Nice place, very clean. Four of us dined on a Friday night.  We started with the Lemongrass Trio appetizer - it was quite nice and perfect for sharing. Hubbie thought the Egg Rolls were the best ever.  Spring Rolls were my favorite.  We each ordered a different entrée.  I had the Tamarind Chicken (ordered not spicy).  It was good and a generous portion.  (It tasted equally good the next day!). Hubbie enjoyed the Grapow Pork HOT- not a bite was left. He said next time he would order Medium heat level.  Friends had the Seafood Pad Thai and the Panang Curry Pork.  Both enjoyed their meals and want to return again.  The Waitress brought out the spice tray so we could adjust the heat of our dishes. Several families but majority were couples. Two waitress managed all the tables.  Busy Friday night but only had slight delays.  Waitress were very attentive.

data.title: Favorite Thai in metro area
data.text: This is my favorite Thai place int he metro. Food tastes great and good quality ingredients . Not chewy chicken like other places.

data.title: Portions are huge!
data.text: My husband and I started out with two drinks and the calamari.  The calamari was good, but not great.  Had we known the portions were so large we would have split a meal, but we both had lunch for the next day. The chicken fried rice was great. The pad thai with tofu was decent. Good meal, good service and we loved the restaurant.

data.title: Best Crab Rangoon Ever!
data.text: Nice place. Crab Rangoon was the best we've ever had! I was a little disappointed when I asked if my entrée selection could be made a little less spicy and was told no. So I ordered a salad which was very good. Highly recommend you try it!

data.title: Better than LuLu's and easier access
data.text: Our daughter directed us to Lemongrass and we were so pleased with our first visit that we will be returning often.  The staff was lovely.  The food was phenomenal.  And the the little details made this restaurant stand out and above many others, especially in its price range.

data.title: Excellent value!
data.text: From the street it doesn't look like much; not fancy or exotic in appearance, but once inside you are taken down a corridor which opens up into a lovely dining area. The tables are set with white tablecloths and candles. Bottomless hot tea (for $2.50) comes in a beautiful ceramic teapot. The ambiance is just right for a date, for a family, or for dining alone. Most impressive was the selection of entrees at extremely reasonable prices. Most noodle/rice/curry/stir-fried dishes (which included meat) were $11.95; some a little higher and some a little lower. They also offered seafood and native dishes (duck, squid, pork belly) for the adventurous. They also had a nice selection of wines, beer, and cocktails. The service was good. We were seated right away and our server was attentive and nice. We were very impressed with the flavor of our meals. I ordered the Yellow Curry and my husband order some kind of stir-fry. I was disappointed at first glance when they brought out the curry because I was really hungry and it didn't look like there was a lot. HOWEVER, the bowl was deep and by the time I added the jasmine rice it was brimming to the top and I could hardly finish. Looks can be deceiving! We will definitely be coming back. I predict several trips there in the near future.

data.title: First time...definitely not the last.
data.text: The service was excellent and extremely friendly. The food was very very good.  Quiet atmosphere in old town Overland Park.

data.title: Comfort food!
data.text:
We took a group to Lemongrass last night, and across the lot of us, we sampled a LOT of items. Everything was really really good, the place was clean, and we'll definitely be back.  I ordered the panang curry with chicken at a medium heat level.  If you are fine with mild buffalo wings, you'll be fine with their medium heat.  My curry was warm and peanuty and I was hard pressed not to pick up the bowl of leftover sauce and just drink it straight down.  My husband ordered the jalapeno hurricane (jalapenos and onions cooked with chicken) at a Thai Hot level, and while some of our friends determined that was far too spicy for their tastes, he was able to down the plate without breaking a sweat.  We also sampled the crab rangoons (light and tasty), the crispy egg rolls (tiny but tasty), the papaya salad (it reminded us of cole slaw), and the hot and sour soup (the only thing that didn't win us over, but we're pretty particular about our hot and sour soup.)

The serving staff were all friendly and did their best to accommodate our group of 15+.  Two thumbs up!

data.title: weeknite dinner out
data.text: Lemongrass is a treasure in downtown Overland Park. All 4 of the dishes we had were fantastic. The restaurant is clean and well done. The service was attentive but not overwhelming. The pad Thai was one of the best I have ever had. This is a place I will go back to! Highly recommend. if you are a lover of hot Thai or like it mild, Lemongrass will satisfy your entire family.

data.title: Thursday dinner
data.text:
Lemongrass was great. All 4 of the dishes we had were fantastic. The restaurant is clean and very prey. The service was attentive but not overwhelming. 
The pad Thai was one of the best I have ever had. 
This is a place I will go back to! Highly recommend.

data.title: Great!
data.text:
My wife and I went and enjoyed a delicious meal about 5pm. The place was really quiet at that point but we had a very friendly server and hostess. 
We loved the crab Rangoon to start with - it's a little more creamy than some places we've had it and it was great. 
I had the cashew stir fry with chicken and it was great, just what you'd expect. My wife had the Grapow with chicken and it was incredible - I was wishing I would've gotten it instead - very full of flavor and just bit of spice to it that made it interesting. Definitely go enjoy a meal here!

data.title: worst Thai food have had in quite a while; chicken salad was awful
data.text: At a group luncheon here, the Thai chicken salad was simply awful in nearly every way. No one at the table enjoyed their meal and many were openly critical. My earlier experience here, however, was a lot better than this last time. Service was also poor. Won't be returning.

data.title: Excellent local Thai cafe
data.text: Superb sauces (though missing cilantro in the Paad Thai). Considerate service often provided by owner. Despite a previous review, prices are very much in line for level of food and dining experience. Deserves local support.

data.title: Superb Thai food
data.text: Best hot and sour soup I've ever had, and I'm an aficionado.  Other dishes also excellent.  My wife and I will definitely return with our daughter and her family.  Not many customers there in a Thursday evening.  Attentive service.  Nice and quiet.

data.title: Ok Oriental Food
data.text: My wife, daughter, and I tried Lemongrass for the first time. We had high expectations because they took so long to construct and open the restaurant. We showed up on a Sunday night around 530pm. We were the only ones there for 40 minutes. The design of the restaurant is great. But for some reason they were playing "oldies" music from the 60-70-80s. Eating to "Jump" by VanHalen on the radio is not what we expected. The food was delivered OK and it really didn't "wow" us. One appetizer, one wine, one lemonade, three entrees was $60. Probably won't go back anytime soon. We live real close.

data.title: Thai-licious
data.text:
I love Thai food for it's freshness and unique flavor combinations.  This restaurant didn't disappoint.  The Hot & Sour soup was home made - not the gelatinous goop you sometimes get.  The broth was clear and thin and the soup was chock full of ingredients.  Delicious!

Everyone at my table enjoyed their entrees which included yellow curry, Paad Thai, Cashew Chicken and my dish of Khao Nam, a fab Loas crispy rice salad.  Yummy.

This restaurant is located in old downtown Overland Park so is a great add-on to a visit to the Farmers Market, a concert at the outdoor pavilion or a movie in the old fashioned movie theater, Rio.

data.title: Welcome to amazing Thai
data.text:
This place opened in Old Overland Park a few months ago and my wife and I decided to give it a try. We'd heard good things from friends. Kansas City has had a long history of mostly average Thai food, so we are always on the look out for something new.  In one word: WOW.

We generally judge all things Thai on two dishes - red curry and pad thai. We were there for red curry night (Monday) and were not disappointed. The vegetables used were fresh (not canned), the rice was perfect and the curry sauce was the best we've had in Kansas City. The pad thai was also perfect. It's a nice looking space, the service was fast and the price was about average for Kansas City.

If you love Thai and you're in KC, give it a shot. It's worth it.
